title: Carl Schurz Park Conservancy’s Annual Halloween Howl + Healthy Hound Fair
description: Enjoy a day of fun at the Halloween Howl and Healthy Hound Fair at Carl Schurz Park, featuring activities for dogs and their owners.
address: Basketball/Hockey Court + John Finley Walk, Yorkville

title: 35th Annual Tompkins Square Halloween Dog Parade
description: Join the canine festival block located on 6th Street between Avenue B and C. The parade is along Avenue B. Registration for dogs in the parade is full, but no ticket is required to attend and watch.
address: 6th Street between Avenue B and C

title: Annual Disability Pride Parade and Festival
description: Join the parade route from Broadway at Madison Square Park to Union Square Park. The festival takes place in Union Square Park from 12-3 pm.
address: Broadway from Madison Square Park to Union Square Park

title: Brooklyn Film Camera Yard Sale
description: Join the yard sale at Brooklyn Film Camera in East Williamsburg.

title: Phoenicia Flea Fall-O-Ween Market at Strong Rope Brewery
description: Visit the Phoenicia Flea market at Strong Rope Brewery in Red Hook.

title: Fourth Annual Irving Square Park Howl-O-Ween Costume Contest
description: Join the fourth annual costume contest at Irving Square Park in Bushwick. $10 to register in the costume contest.

title: Annual Riverside Park Pup Halloween Parade and Costume Contest
description: Participate in the annual Halloween parade and costume contest starting at Dinosaur Playground on 96th St and ending at Ellington's Cafe at 105th St. Rain date is 10/25.

title: Fourth Annual National Indigenous Peoples of the Americas Parade
description: Join the parade at Madison Square Park and E 26th Street in Flatiron. The opening ceremony starts at 10 am, followed by the parade at 12 pm.
address: Madison Square Park / E 26th Street, Flatiron

title: Annual Muddy Paws Rescue Block Party
description: Join the block party at W 54th Street between 9th and 10th Avenues in Hell’s Kitchen.
address: W 54th Street between 9th + 10th Aves, Hell’s Kitchen

title: The Great Community Bake Sale
description: Participate in the bake sale at 180 Maiden Lane in FIDI. Free admission, $10 vouchers get you a baked good and a donation to NYC-based nonprofits providing essential services to New Yorkers in need.

title: Bero Block Party
description: Enjoy free food and drinks while supplies last at the Bero Block Party at 114 Kenmare St in Nolita.

title: Arcade Swap Meet
description: Join the arcade swap meet at Wonderville in Bushwick.

title: Annual Brooklyn Synth + Pedal Expo
description: Explore the Brooklyn Synth + Pedal Expo at 100 Sutton Event Space in Greenpoint. Admission is $5-20.

title: Fad Market: Pop-Up
description: Visit the Fad Market pop-up at Brooklyn Brewery in Williamsburg.

title: Hunter College MFA + BFA Open Studios
description: Explore over 120 student artist studios open to the public at 205 Hudson Street in Tribeca.

title: The Annual Art in Odd Places Festival: Nothing
description: Join the festival at 14th Street between First and Third Aves on Saturday and between Sixth and Ninth Aves on Sunday.
address: 14th Street between First and Third Aves, Saturday; 14th Street between Sixth and Ninth Aves, Sunday

title: Harlem Open Artist Studio Tour
description: Explore 20 locations across Harlem during the open artist studio tour.

title: 17th Annual Flatbush Artists Open Studios
description: Visit 23 locations throughout Victorian Flatbush during the open studios event.

title: 29th Annual Gowanus Open Studios
description: Explore 400+ artists across 90 locations in Gowanus during the open studios event.

title: Manhattan Vintage Clothing Show
description: Explore vintage clothing at the Manhattan Vintage Clothing Show at Metropolitan Pavilion in Chelsea. $25 general admission, $20 for students.

title: Voice of Space: UFOs and Paranormal Phenomena
description: Explore the exhibition at The Drawing Center in Soho. Free admission.

title: Renoir Drawings
description: Visit the exhibition at The Morgan Library + Museum in Murray Hill. Admission is $25 general, $17 seniors, $13 students, free for college students on the first Sunday of the month, free to all every Friday 5-8 pm (with RSVP).
address: The Morgan Library + Museum, Murray Hill

title: High Wire: Calder’s Circus at 100
description: Visit the exhibition at Whitney Museum of American Art in the Meatpacking District. Admission is $30 general, $24 seniors/students, free for 25 and under, free to all every Friday 5-10 pm, free to all every second Sunday.
address: Whitney Museum of American Art, Meatpacking District

title: Free Outdoor Movie: The Nightmare Before Christmas
description: Enjoy a free outdoor movie screening of The Nightmare Before Christmas at Sunset Park.

title: Kweendom
description: Join the Kweendom LGBTQ+ comedy and storytelling show at Pete’s Candy Store in Williamsburg. Free admission, donations welcome.

title: Fifth Annual Queer Spooky Shorts
description: Enjoy a night of short plays with spooky Halloween themes presented by NYC’s oldest LGBTQ+ theater company, The Other Side of Silence, at The Flea Theater in Tribeca. Free admission.

title: Paid Protest Presents: The Roast of Andrew Cuomo and Eric Adams
description: Join the roast featuring local comedians at Silo in Bushwick. Suggested admission is $15.

title: Awkward Sex… and the City Storytelling Show
description: Join the storytelling show at Friends and Lovers in Crown Heights. Admission is $10 in advance, $15 at the door.

title: Best Night Ever Comedy Show
description: Enjoy a night of stand-up comedy at El Santo Taqueria in East Williamsburg/Bushwick. Admission is $12 in advance, $16 on the day of the show.

title: A Drinking Game NYC: Clue
description: Join the drinking game comedy troupe at Crown Hill Theatre in Crown Heights. Admission is $25.05.

title: Bitches Brew Comedy Show
description: Enjoy a women-produced and hosted comedy show at Halyards in Gowanus. Free admission, tips welcome.

title: Nu Metal Night
description: Join the nu metal night at TV Eye in Ridgewood. Admission is $15.65.
